value.title: How to get started with Azure API Management | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to get started with Azure API Management, a service that helps protect and manage your APIs.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gA2yxwKo0M0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to quickly connect to a Linux VM with SSH | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to quickly connect to a Linux Virtual Machine (VM) with secure shell (SSH). If you have Linux VMs that are running inside of Microsoft Azure, you can easily establish an SSH connection.    For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/

value.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure
value.excerpt: Discover Azure's three approaches to deploying cloud resources -- public, private, and hybrid -- and learn the difference each makes in your Azure services.

value.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
value.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

value.title: Understand virtualization
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

value.title: Connect an app to Azure Storage
value.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and C# or JavaScript code to connect it to Azure Storage.

value.title: Create and manage Cognitive Services
value.excerpt: Azure Cognitive Services enable developers to easily add cognitive features into their applications. Learn how to configure and manage these services for your AI application needs.

value.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
value.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

value.title: Detect and analyze faces with the Face service
value.excerpt: Face detection, analysis, and recognition is an important capability for artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The Face cognitive service in Azure makes it easy integrate these capabilities into your applications.

value.title: Explore data storage and processing in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore data storage and processing in Azure

value.title: Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure

value.title: Introduction to Linux on Azure
value.excerpt: Discover the unique benefits of running Linux on Azure, and how to run Linux-based applications and workloads in the cloud with Azure.

value.title: Introduction to Docker containers
value.excerpt: Introduction to Docker containers

value.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
value.excerpt: Learn about SRE, an engineering discipline that helps you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

value.title: Introduction to GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

value.title: Introduction to machine learning
value.excerpt: A high-level overview of machine learning for people with little or no knowledge of computer science and statistics. You’ll be introduced to some essential concepts, explore data, and interactively go through the machine learning life-cycle - using Python to train, save, and use a machine learning model like we would in the real world.

value.title: Protect your virtual machines by using Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Use Azure Backup to help protect the data for on-premises servers, virtual machines, virtualized workloads, SQL Server, Azure Files, and more.

value.title: Read text with the Computer Vision service
value.excerpt: Optical character recognition (OCR) enables artificial intelligence (AI) systems to read text in images, enabling applications to extract information from photographs, scanned documents, and other sources of digitized text.

value.title: Enabling secure remote work using Windows Virtual Desktop | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Windows Virtual Desktop (WVD) is a comprehensive desktop and app virtualization service running in Azure to enable secure remote work. Christiaan Brinkhoff joins Scott Hanselman to show how WVD is different from other desktop virtualization technologies, as well as how easy it is to implement and maintain.

value.title: How to create App Services in the Azure portal | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, you will learn how to create web apps using the Azure App service in the Azure portal. value.title: How to export your resources to CSV using the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: The Azure Portal allows you to customize the information you'd like to export. In this video of the Azure Portal "How To" Series, learn how to easily export your files to CSV.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com     Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

value.title: How to quickly connect to Windows VMs using RDP | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to quickly connect to Windows Virtual Machines (VMs) with Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). Watch how easy and fast it is to connect to your virtual machines in Azure.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/  Get started with 12

value.title: Introducing new Azure API Management capabilities | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Miao Jiang joins Scott Hanselman discuss the API economy and how companies must master the challenges inherent in building, maintaining, managing, and exposing APIs to participate. That's where Azure API Management can help. Azure API Management is a solution for publishing APIs to external and internal

value.title: Issue and accept verifiable credentials using Azure Active Directory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Sydney Morton joins Scott Hanselman to show how verifiable credentials enable you to own and prove who you are in the digital world. See how to enable decentralized identity through seamless user and developer experiences.  ⏩ 0:00 – Intro ⏩ 0:37 – Overview ⏩ 3:01 – Demo – end user experience ⏩ 6:14 –

value.title: Allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset
value.excerpt: Learn how to allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset.

value.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration
value.excerpt: Explore the first two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration.

value.title: Create a long-running serverless workflow with Durable Functions
value.excerpt: Learn how to orchestrate a long-running workflow as a set of activities using scalable and cost-effective Durable Functions.

value.title: Build and run a web application with the MEAN stack on an Azure Linux virtual machine
value.excerpt: Learn how to decide if the MEAN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, AngularJS, and Node.js) is a good choice for you and set up a MEAN-based web application on a new Azure Linux virtual machine.
